reviewText:
This isn't really a review, but as I found the product description sorely lacking, I decided to compile this list of product information for the benefit of prospective buyers. I hope you find this information useful.

GLADIATOR (2000) - 155 minutes - Director: Ridley Scott - Starring: Russell Crowe, Joaquin Phoenix, Connie Nielsen - Genre: Epic/Historical - Plot: When a Roman general is betrayed and his family murdered by an emperor's corrupt son, he comes to Rome as a gladiator to seek revenge. R

THE BOURNE ULTIMATUM (2007) - 115 minutes - Director: Paul Greengrass - Starring: Matt Damon, Julia Stiles, David Strathairn - Genre: Action/Spy - Plot: Jason Bourne dodges a ruthless CIA official and his agents from a new assassination program while searching for the origins of his life as a trained killer. PG-13

WANTED (2008) - 110 minutes - Director: Timur Bekmambetov - Starring: James McAvoy, Angelina Jolie, Morgan Freeman - Genre: Action - Plot: A frustrated office worker learns that he is the son of a professional assassin, and that he shares his father's superhuman killing abilities. R

FAST AND FURIOUS (2009) - 107 minutes - Director: Justin Lin - Starring: Vin Diesel, Paul Walker, Michelle Rodriguez - Genre: Action - Plot: Brian O'Conner, now working for the FBI in LA, teams up with Dominic Toretto to bring down a heroin importer by infiltrating his operation. PG-13

THE MUMMY: TOMB OF THE DRAGON EMPEROR (2008) - 112 minutes - Director: Rob Cohen - Starring: Brendan Fraser, Jet Li - Genre: Action/Adventure - Plot: In the Far East, a young archaeologist unearths the mummy of the first Emperor of Qin -- a shape-shifting entity cursed by a witch centuries ago. PG-13

Now lets crunch some numbers. This box set costs $22.54, and contains 4 films. When we divide to find the price of each individual film, we get a price of $4.51 per film. This is a good deal to own this diverse set of action-packed films that any film junkie should enjoy. If you found this information helpful, please give it a like. Thanks.
